alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 515 PM MDT... At 445 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northwest of Weskan, or 17 miles northeast of Cheyenne Wells, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 157 and 161, and between mile markers 165 and 169. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central Colorado...and west central Kansas.
